Reviews.Title: “Stylish & friendly - great location”
Reviews.Author: lasolisita
Reviews.Content: Located right in the heart of Berlin, close to all major shopping areas. Funky & Stylish design and probably most interesting spa ever seen, although pretty small. Come to the Q if you want a somehwat new kind of design hotel, full of beautiful people in their hotel bar and a great & cool looking spa area. We espeically loved the bath tub next to our bed. Definitely recommendable.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you Hotel Q!”
Reviews.Author: T T
Reviews.Content: Berlin is always worth a trip and I can’t count the times I have been there! But during my last stay I experienced the icing on the cake. What a sensational visit thanks to the Hotel Q! and it’s staff. Nowadays you can find “design hotels” all over the place, as it has become a hype but most are just wannabe. Not the Hotel Q! – it’s true design in architecture, staff, choice, service and dedication. From the moment of my arrival till to my departure, I was greeted and attended with an “honest” smile of friendly and helpful staff. The rooms were very clean and fulfilled all expectation for a recuperative sleep. The breakfast was another highlight and most welcoming after a rough night out. The most delicious fresh bread and an amazing selection of toppings – not quantity but quality and offering. Ham, Cheese, fish, sweet, cereals, vegetables, quarks, fresh herbs, fruits etc. It’s was all there and I was even able to enjoy my Latte Macchiato with lactose free milk - very grateful not having to drink soymilk! Thanks again for all and you can be sure I’ll be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in a very fancy hotel!”
Reviews.Author: fareed_h
Reviews.Content: After staying in Hotel Q with my wife for our anniversary i must say, that some bad critics here are really not close to reality and probably too personal! We had an early flight and although we arrived at 8 in the morning, we had a really warm welcome and a very good first impression of the hotel (ok, it took a while finding it,there was no sign:)) really friendly staff and great design! our room (503) was a bright and very modern room with the typical Q design we had seen on the website already.The Spa area is a real highlight, especially because of the sandroom and the great massages (Bali Royal).Even the breakfast buffet, which was served until 1pm ! on sunday was devine.Freshmade pancakes with maple sirup was our highlight no.2. All in all a one of the best experiences and definitly recommendable!

Reviews.Title: “Clean room with crisp sheets, extensive Breakfast Buffet”
Reviews.Author: nuitdepluie
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 503 which had view on the street. The room was very clean, the sheets were crispy fresh and there is lots of storage to put away your clothes. There were complimentary magazines like Vogue, GQ, etc and minimal complimentary shower gel, shampoo and bodylotion. The breakfast buffet had lots of variety, also for vegetarians. They even had Miso-Soup and little herbs etc you could cut fresh from a growing patch to put on your sandwich etc. The egg dishes were to order which is much nicer than a stall bucket of scrambled eggs lying around for hours. The service was very nice and helpfull (and good looking...). You can also eat dinner there, Tue - Sat they have a cook in-house for Thai, Sun/Mo u can order Italian from the next-door Italian restaurant. We just had the Panna Cotta and it was very good. The bar can also fix you some great cocktails and they go out of their way to also mix what is not on the menu. The area is very nice, next to Ku'damm, Savignyplatz S-Bahn station and Uhlandstr. (Nr.1) Metro are just minutes away. There are lots of restaurants also around Savignyplatz.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cduncan261
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Q Hotel the staff were very helpfull, good selection at breakfast. The rooms were very clean and good to look at although it is a bit like design gone mad! We had booked a travel zoo deal and we got free bottle of wine & cocktails and some sweets in our room. Would recommend this hotel, very good location

Reviews.Title: “Uber Cool”
Reviews.Author: fairyarse
Reviews.Content: The very friendly greeting at Hotel Q was made even better when arrived very early and expected to leave our bags but were told our room was ready anyway so we could check in! There was a welcome pack of sweets fruit and cocktails there for us already. The room was amazing if a little up close and personal for two friends but we were prepared for that already, the bed was very comfy and every thing was very clean and the hotel was ideally situated for walking, buses, the U bahn and S bahn. The Breakfast was lovely with everything you could want to chose from, even live cress to cut. The staff were overall extremely very helpful and smiley apart from one miserable young waiter/bar man who we seemed to upset each day by just being there but we used it as entertainment and didn't let it bother us! I would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “You either hate it or love it !”
Reviews.Author: madamtraveller
Reviews.Content: I had mixed feelings about booking this hotel. Once I arrived at the hotel I kind of understood why some people really hated it and others absolutely loved it. The location is first class, steps away from the main shopping street Kudamm I believe that people who usually stay in anonymous Sheraton-Hilton type of hotels with vast (mediocre quality) buffets and personnel treating them as sub-gods will find it difficult here. The friendly staff is young and easy going with a cool attitude. People had complained about that in their reviews. I found it quite refreshing and hip! Yes, the rooms are on the small side. But very clean and kind of sexy! The shower is very comfortable yet fully exposed! The toilet is in a separate room, creating a quite spot. I thought it to be the ideal room for couples! The bed with its awkward wooden frame is only accessible from one side. It is kind of hard to get in. Not my favorite design, I must admit. But once I managed to get it I had a very comfortable and relaxing sleep. Our standard room faced the street Knesebeck and was really very quiet! The doors are somehow noise proof. You barely hear anything. There are red lights everywhere, adding to the quirkiness and kitsch. I really loved it! The breakfast buffet was well stocked with various cold cuts, cheese, fresh herbs and Mediterranean varieties. You could also additionally order omelets and fried eggs. If I would go back to Berlin, I would definitely stay in the Hotel Q!

Reviews.Title: “Wunderbar”
Reviews.Author: gillianski
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel with my daughter for her 21st birthday. We were lucky to get one of the two rooms with balconies - and had free champagne, cocktails, sweets and fruit delivered to the room. Staff are really friendly and speak excellent English. Loved the dining room and breakfasts were first-class. There's a 24-hour shop nearby (turn left at the front door, walk 5 mins and cross the main road - it's on the right-hand side of the street). I'd recommend using Savignyplatz as the nearest tube stop (turn right at the front door and walk straight ahead - it's about a 3 min. walk). We spent most of our time in East Berlin which was much cheaper than the area surrounding the hotel. I'd recommend Hotel Q! We really enjoyed our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Loved This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lancsman1
Reviews.Content: Here are our thoughts on this hotel: Location: Just of Kurfurstendam and about 5 minutes walk from the U Bahn at Uhlandstrasse or the S Bahn at Savignyplatz. You can walk to the Zoologischer Garten in about 10-15 minutes. The road is quiet but it's only a very short walk from the nearby bustling streets. Exterior: There are no obvious signs outside the hotel to tell you that you have arrived although there is a large Q motif on the door. If you have the address, you won't have any problems. However, if you haven't and think it will be easy to find, you might struggle. Reception: The reception is small and can be cramped with more than a few people in it. The staff are very friendly and helpful. We were a bit apprehensive having seen some of the comments but, honestly, we felt the staff couldn't have been nicer. There aren't any safes in individual rooms but there are safes available at reception, free of charge. Also, when you check in, you'll be given a code for the wifi, which is free. Corridors: Yes-they are red but it's not oppressive. The room numbers are on the vertical lights outside the rooms. The numbers are small and located about a third of the way up. Rooms: We loved our room which was a standard one (i.e. without the bath tub). They are a little on the small size but storage space is adequate. The bed is quirky. It's large enough and comfortable. However, it can be a bit difficult to get on and off. Don't forget to check out the ceiling when lying on the bed. The shower in the room is strange but when you are used to it, it kind of works. However, you need to be comfortable with your travelling companion. The sink in the room wasn't a problem. Spa: The spa was lovely. It's fairly small and would be crowded with more than about 15 people in it. It has a sauna and a steam room and a lounging area with 4 beds which isn't many. Be aware that the spa is only open between 1800-2200. Finishing Touches: Shortly after arrival, we were given a small bottle of sparkling wine and a cocktail and on our morning of departure found a small bag of sweets on our bedroom door. General: We absolutely loved this hotel. We can understand that it isn't for everyone but we wanted something a bit different and got it. At the right price, we'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting place, friendly staff and great location”
Reviews.Author: kim_night
Reviews.Content: When we entered we were greeted warmly with staff that spoke great english. They allowed us to check in early and we were impressed by the rooms and general decor of the hotel too. Although parts of the room were a bit tight - it was easy enough to get around it. We liked the different design. The beds were comfortable and the shower was good. If you like more than one pillow you may have to ask reception though as we only had one each in our room. They also gave us a welcome gift of water, sweets and fruit which was lovely. The breakfast was great too - lots of variety of hot and cold foods. The hotel is in a great location and close to transport. Would certainly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Rare find”
Reviews.Author: Horriest
Reviews.Content: This hotel is wonderful, the service excellent. The staff were really friendly and professional and nothing was too much trouble. The breakfast was amazing as was the dinner, although the Thai menu was a bit of a surprise as there was no clue this is what it would be. The hotel is really stylish but not pretentious, lots of hip Berliners came in for late night drinks which added to the atmosphere in the bar area. The location was really good, with excellent train links to the rest of the city round the corner. Would definitely recommend. Be aware thought that the bath or shower is in the room and there is no privacy so choose carefully who you go with!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for exploring Berlin”
Reviews.Author: dsj247
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a couple of nights so that we could explore Berlin and its Christmas Markets. The location was great with both over and underground stations within walking distance. The room was of a good size but the overly designed bed area dominated the room and I kept stubbing my toes on the extended lip. The separate toilet did feel a little like a cupboard but at least it was a good sized cupboard! Breakfast was included and it had a good choice supported by excellent staff. Unfortunately because the hotel was full, we ended up having to share a coffee table rather than a breakfast table which wasnt ideal. Overall the staff were great and the hotel was good value. Worth checking out if it's in the right location for you and the price is right.

Reviews.Title: “Great bar, central location”
Reviews.Author: Lizzie_1986406
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at Hotel Q! The room was clean, functional, nicely designed, the staff were EXTREMELY helpful and spoke perfect english. The bartender was fantastic and knew every cocktail in the book :-) Hotel was very close to the subway and it was very easy to get around. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: dfabes
Reviews.Content: Great rooms, delicious breakfast, service with a smile.

Reviews.Title: “avoid lackluster lover's package”
Reviews.Author: Eric R
Reviews.Content: to start the evening, we had to change rooms after checking in since they placed us in ash tray that was doubling as a hotel room. i purchased the lover's package since i was planning to propose to my wife. first off, the bath tub is placed right next to the bed. this isnt that bad but your room is tiny. tokyo/nyc tiny. the mattress for a below average sized bed was always damp. the lover's package included a rose pedal bath. they deflowered 2 roses, tossed them into the tub and then filled the bath about 20% full with room temperature water. the romantic dinner at the restaurant (doubles as a small night club) is okay. we can't hate too much on the dinner but the room is soo bad you just want to hate on the entire hotel. Anyway, if they cut their prices by 50%...not a bad spot to stay. otherwise, stay @ Soho House Berlin or another nicer hotel. this place might of been hip in the early 90's...but the hotel's best days are far behind.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: charliegirl123
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel and rooms are fab and the bed was really comfy. Very modern and cool the only slight disappointment was the hot breakfast just stick to the buffet which was lovely. Some fab restaurants nearby Ali Baba was great value with really good food. The must to do thing is the walking tour which was fantastic and full of facts and a great way to see the city...overall best break in years.

Reviews.Title: “Good value- price ratio”
Reviews.Author: Mickeytzan
Reviews.Content: Modern hotel situated in a very nice location in the new centre of Berlin close to the shopping streets. Its a small city boutique hotel with extravagant design. The rooms are well decorated not very big but enough for a couple. The surprise was the Spa (voted as one of the best spas on Europe). Its a small spa but the sand relaxing room worths a try. Higly suggested for what you pay. Tip: there is an Italian restaurant that we enjoyed a lot very near.

Reviews.Title: “Nice modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pamina77
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay in this hotel. The room with bath was just perfect to relax after a long visiting day. And the breakfast was nice and fresh. I recommend it because its close to everything by U-bahn or S-bahn and Berlin is also nice to discover by bike. I'm planning to go back to that city once and I will be happy to choose Q hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “People should be Q-ing round the corner to stay at this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Stephanie E
Reviews.Content: The design and style of this hotel are it's major selling point; although this should not make you think that it has style over substance. Great service, comfortable rooms and an unbeatable location for sightseeing (the nearest S-bahn is 1 minutes walk away) make this a thoroughly enjoyable stay. It is pricey, but well worth the money. A special mention should go to the hotel's excellent fruhstuck; a top breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, overprized breakfast”
Reviews.Author: hohygen
Reviews.Content: I Stayed inn the hotel for a week. The staff was friendly. The design made the stay more pleasant. There were only one clear sorrow the breakfast price. The breakfast was 20 €, and to be honest not to impressing.

Reviews.Title: “Funky Design”
Reviews.Author: Lenny1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for business at the recommendation of some colleagues. Definitely more of a tourist oriented hotel. My room was small with a lot of features that were simply design for design's sake. For example, the sink was in the room next to the bed, and the bed was built into a curved-wood paneled platform that I had to clamber over each time I got into bed. Room was also on the front of the building so I couldn't open the window because the street noise was excessive. Room finishes and materials were all simple and not luxurious.

Reviews.Title: “Design Hotel????”
Reviews.Author: captainkirk1
Reviews.Content: I guess they forgot the word BAD when classifying it as a Design Hotel. Most inconvenient rooms with an oversized useless bathtub in the middle and attached bed that made it impossible to get in and out of it, not exactly helped by being the softest and worst mattrass ever! The rooms are so small that when you sit at the plank that serves as a working desk, your partner can not get by. No safe to lock your valuables away and a TV that is the size of my ipad! Adding a cool foto wall paper to the ceiling and red lights in the corridors does not make it a Design Hotel. Great breakfast was the highlight even though the staff is snotty and slightly too cool! Save your money, there are much better choices in this amazing city!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jontycLondon
Reviews.Content: Good hotel. Nice design, though some of it's a bit over designed, but made it interesting. Only complaint was loud music from next door early on Sunday morning - hopefully just a one off thing

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular experience!”
Reviews.Author: foodietrotter
Reviews.Content: I was in Berlin with my partner-the first for both of us. The hotel we chose definitely made our experience. The area, Charlottenberg, is really quaint. It is sort of hidden behind the big street Ku'damm. Lots of small little cafes, restaurants and independent fashion boutiques are in the area. We found the hotel to be well connected to both S-bahn and U-bahn stations. What was really nice about the area is that there aren't too many tourisaccet traps here. Accessibility from here to the rest of the city is great. The hotel itself was impressive. I loved rhe design aspect. I had expected it to be smaller and less comfortable, but was pleasantly surprised. The rooms were spacious and designed very well. The rooms had all amenities required for a high quality stay. Loved the design of the bathroom area andhow it was integrated into the room. Staff were super friendly, helpful and professional. Breakfast was high quality and of a good spread without giving off the mass produced feeling. The use of a very nice spa, bathrobe and bathroom slippers was included in our stay. We got a special deal with the hotel by booking directly through their website, however the spa is included for all residents of thr hotel. Rooms were superbly cleaned and in a timely fashion. I would definitely recommend this hotel for visiting Berlin in a more couple setting, or adults travelling together. I would choose to stay here if I was travelling alone as well.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, good location"”
Reviews.Author: BASAY
Reviews.Content: We were there as part of romantic trip and it was a good hotel to stay in, w good location and nice people, although the room was very small. The breakfast was v good although a little overpriced and the options at the restaurant at night were v few w no good service (just 1 person attending all the tables/bar)

Reviews.Title: “Cool place, great loaction”
Reviews.Author: Africa_Travels
Reviews.Content: Quite a different sort of place. Centrally located near the Kuhdamm it has easy access from various Metro Stations. Just around the hotel there is an abundance of bars, restaurants and shops. The place itself is sort of uebercool which was great for us, but may put some people off. Nice rooms which were funkily done, if a little small. Downstairs a nice spa although we just had a look in and didn’t actually try it. Seems we had some sort of special rate, but at 85 Euro it was definitely great value. Found the staff to be super friendly and hip. Went down well with us, but maybe not for everyone. Chic bar with great cocktails

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem, highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: thisisme?ok
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night. Nice funky and original room with a bathtub next to the bed (ideal for couples I guess). Extremely helpful and young staff. The best 2 bids for me are the breakfeast (some unusual items in the buffet) and the little spa in the basement. The hotel is clearly geared towards couples or singles, I would avoid if a family or friends you don;t like to get intimate with. Overall, highly recommended. Great value too

Reviews.Title: “The Q staff were extremely helpful and our 4 night stay with 8 friends was memorable”
Reviews.Author: smokeyBeverley
Reviews.Content: Great location for nearby restaurants including Cassambalis (recommended) and A-Trane jazz club. Savignyplatz very close great for chilling on a night with a beer or two. Liked the Q Hotel which proved a great base for our various birthday events. We liked the bedrooms and preferred it to other hotels because it was different.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice! Great location, nice staff..”
Reviews.Author: Lingaro
Reviews.Content: We were happy, that we chose this hotel as we had a fab time there! The staff is ever so polite, everything was perfect down to evry detail. Very professional service. There is Free wifi and the room design is one of a kind ;) Unfortnately, we didn't get a room with the funky bath (we were in 312) but still it was very pleasant. They also paid attention to select a new brand of toiletteries.(Ritual) All in all, highly recommended as it's well situated right in the heart of Charlottenburg, close to Uhlandstrasse U-Bahn station. There are lots of caffees, shops and good German restaurants nearby (Schildkrote for example). It's easy to access from Schonefeld to ZooPark station with the RegionalBahn (takes about 38mins) and an additional 10 minutes walk to the Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Quality, style, service, location, but most of all ... TRULY SEXY!”
Reviews.Author: RaOe
Reviews.Content: For the ones of us travelling around the globe all the time, finding appropriate accomodation can become quite an obsessive hobby: Thickness and density of spring mattress, amount of (or better avoidance of) useless "dust catchers", layers of the toilet paper, originality of the interior, level of amenities ... even down to the brands of the little shower and conditioner bottles gets rated and evaluated. That narrows the list of potential establishments in Berlin maybe to a list of 10-15 to choose from (which is absolutly outstanding). But moving beyond this level of (pre-)selection, it all comes down to sex appeal! It's like going to a party: You can have a cool location, great food, the perfect sound system ... but in the end, all that counts is the style of the host and the sexiness of the party crowd!!!!! Q hotel has the sexiest staff (both male and female) in Berlin ... and even more ... they are extremely friendly too. Based on that they attract a really interesting, hip and sexy crowd in both their bar and hotel. So even in my business armor returning from boring business missions I always feel a bit like "Sonny Crockett" when I "dive" back into the Q-crowd. If you're not a member of Soho House (or it's fully booked once again!) this is the only place in Berlin that makes you feel that way! PS: And it alyways makes you wonder who are those good looking people that can afford to party all night at the Q-bar, stretch out on the little Q-beach in the basement with their MacBookAirs and still manage to pay their bills all the time. Looking forward to my next stay. R.

Reviews.Title: “for me: disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Janis001
Reviews.Content: Yes, this hotel has helpful and friendly staff, a comfortable bed and a sexy bathroom, but very dry air inside, especially inside room. My double room was small, fortunately i stayed there alone. Second matter was noise early morning (about 6 AM) from hotel's patio, that's way i had to sleep without open window. The hotel is well located, parking is near hotel and cost 19 EUR/day. Free wifi worked quickly and securely.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for money - very good location”
Reviews.Author: fabiofilo
Reviews.Content: Went to the Q! hotel for the second time in a few years, I found a very good offer on hotels.com for a queen bed room. The room was spotless, with a confortable bed. The spa is really worth a visit; the staff was very helpful. The hotel is very well located, with plenty of buses, Sbahn and Ubahn nearby. The bus 109 to go to Tegel airport is just around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “It was really excellent staying in Berlin...”
Reviews.Author: DarkoSplit
Reviews.Content: We have found this hotel via i-escape site and we haven't regreted. Everything was exactly as per our expectations; city, hotel, service... Hotel itself is excellent with design, location and service up to highest standards. Beds are so comfortable that we felt like we sleep in our home bed, breakfast was superb and tasty. Front desk was helpfull, quick, very much client oriented but not pestering...

Reviews.Title: “cool hip hotel”
Reviews.Author: jozobami
Reviews.Content: I noticed some rather bad reviews for this hotel, but didnt experiece any of that when i stayed there. i was very happy with the hotel room (with tub), it was stylish, clean and esthetically well done- though it was on the small side, it didn't bother me at all. i think the breakfast was great and staff treated us very well. i would stay there again if the Hotel Funk (totally different style though!!!) was unavailable.

Reviews.Title: “disappointing..”
Reviews.Author: travelpussy_minga
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the hotel because I read about the design etc. which amused me when I saw the hotel in real - nothing special actually looked quite "selfmade"... To name the good things first. It was tidy, the breakfast was very good and they offer AVEDA products in the bathroom. When I was there they had a very noisy party-event in the evening which you couldn´t ignore especially not when they don´t even supply earplugs at the reception or in the room. My room didn´t have a seperate bathroom (but a seperate room for the toilet) so shower is located right next to the bed. Whoever this may like.. All in all of course the hotel is okay but in my opinion far away from being worth the rate - sorry!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: TheStig0031
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure if the hotel is worth all of it's stars. I.m.o. it's more a 3,5 to 4 star hotel. Nevertheless we had a great stay. The interior of the lobby is really quirky but perhaps somewhat outdated. The room was equipped with a nice size bed, lots of storage space and an open plan bathroom making it more roomy. The staff behind the counter is polite and friendly. Though being pretty expensive the hotel aims mainly on young adults. If you like traditional German hotels this probably won't be your cup of tea. But if you're looking for a unique hotel which stands out of the herd Hotel Q! is a great place to stay. Staying at the hotel overnight is okay though we had a bit of a problem adjusting the room temperature. The room was a bit too hot due to unnecessary heating. The location is really excellent. Just around the corner you'll find the Ku'damm, the main shopping area of western Berlin. The U-Bahn (underground) is located at approximately 5 minutes from the hotel. We preferred taking the S-Bahn (trains) on Savignyplatz station which is at about the same distance. All in all we had a great stay and would without a doubt recommend this hotel to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Sleeping with style”
Reviews.Author: AhoiNadjeschda
Reviews.Content: The hotel has an amazing, modern design - however, not in all cases does form follow function. The bathrooms of the spacious suites (however, more a big room than a suite) are integrated in an open room concept - which looks stylish but is slightly impractical if you require any privacy. The breakfast menue is good and staff friendly, location unbeatable to exlore Berlin. Despite being in the centre of everything, the windows are so good that not a sound enters your dreams. Makes for great quiet sleeping.

Reviews.Title: “Nice romantic and quiet hotel in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: xavke
Reviews.Content: We were there with friends and had 2 rooms on the sixth floor (room 602 and 603),the only 2 rooms with terrace (standard room) and we like very much our room ,nice design and the beds are super,the rooms are soundproof and there was no noise from the streets ,the location is perfect for the metro and train. For the ladies there is kurfustendam with 1000 shops :-) ... breakfast is very delicious with a lot of choice (fresh fruit juice),the only negatice point in this hotel is the bar ,don't go in the evenings here because this is a member bar and there was nobody on a saturday evening . Please book room 602 and 603 ,you have a nice view to the streets ,because backyard view is not so nice

Reviews.Title: “form over function bombs”
Reviews.Author: maus57
Reviews.Content: This hotel was filled with annoying features, from the red-light illumination in the lift and corridors, to the teeny-tiny room numbers, the awkward curving bed frame, the shower and sink IN the room, the illogically arranged plethora of light switches, the appalling lack of hooks and towel racks, the dearth of flat surfaces for accessing open luggage, and the cheesy finishes (what exactly is the POINT of fake ostrich leather wall coverings?!?!). It is trendy to the point of banality and already showings its age in terms of design. Somebody needs to point out that the emperor has no clothes. For the sake of the people of New Orleans, I hope that Brad's pet architect is NOT involved in designing any of the housing he is allegedly assisting with down there. Honestly, has this architect ever stayed in one of the rooms he designed (no, not a lavish suite, but a typical double such as the one we had to suffer)?!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: GlobalVickx
Reviews.Content: Was here during the ITB this and last year and this is a nice property cozy, though a litte expensive during this time

Reviews.Title: “Terrible customer service”
Reviews.Author: Bata_12_10
Reviews.Content: I have book the hotel via Booking, obviously using my valid credit card as a guarantee, however the hotel, without any e-mail correspondence with me, canceled my booking claiming that the card is not valid. After calling my bank I have found out that it is their system's fault, however the hotel continued to claim that my card is not valid, which is very rude from anyone especially in hospitality management. Our mail correspondence continued for 24h, always with another person, but in the same rude style as they were offering no solution for their system's fault and still claiming that it is only my problem. After this I will never again stay in such a rude hotel, there are other establishments in Berlin with far more pleasant customer service. Thank you Q hotel for reminding me that not all is in design :-).

Reviews.Title: “The best Hotel in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: smokeyta
Reviews.Content: Well, this was one of the best hotels I've ever had the pleasure of staying in. the instant you walk into the reception and are greeted by the multi-lingual staff, you are given a welcoming feeling which is missing from many hotels frequented around the world today. the warm feeling of the hallways leading to the rooms has a sexy red glow that allures you to the mood of the place. the rooms follow this high standard and the double room with bath whilst narrower than it seems in the pictures, is perfectly ample for a couple. the look of the room is uber-modern with flowing curves and quirky features. there are so many features to the hotel that make it unique. we have marked the location down to 3 pips due to the fact that the attractions we went to were all in the east of Berlin and whilst the the transport system in Berlin is nothing short of outstanding, nothing really of interest was within walking distance of hotel q. the staff at the front desk could not be more helpful and just asking a question provided you with above and beyond answers. excellent. highly recommended hotel, do stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Cool Hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: UKDWB
Reviews.Content: Just got back from spending 9 days at the Q. Very nice boutique style hotel. Staff were the best, nothing was too much for them. The location is excellent, just off Ku'dam, don't eat on Ku'dam, explore all the side streets around the hotel, really good restaurants are within walking distance. Nice bar, with small out door section, you would nver know you were in the middle of the city.

Reviews.Title: “trendy hotel with great service and facilities”
Reviews.Author: madameswanLondon
Reviews.Content: this is a really lovely, unusual design hotel very contemporary. efficient staff who spoke very good english. they all look like models!! the room was minimalistic,clean and excellently laid out. comfy bed and good products in the bathroom. ipod dock which we appreciated. the breakfast was excellent! the bar was beautiful and not too crowded. the hotel has a toch of eroticism about it. if you like the traditional flowery carpets and curtains kind of hotel this hotel might be a bit too trendy for you..we loved it and will recommend it to couples who want a nice,different kind of experience different from the big hotel chains. it is in a nice area close to designer shops,restaurants and trains. we found it to be great value

Reviews.Title: “More than 100%....”
Reviews.Author: Hotelfan69
Reviews.Content: I do travel a lot and have stayed at many hotels in Berlin, for business purposes I decided to book Hotel Q but also due to the location, next to Kurfürstendamm and close to Messe Berlin. This is really a great hotel, rooms are large and do have huge bathtubs, separate shower and separate toilet, I liked the different candys you find in your room. Staff is extremely friendly and helpful, I felt like 'coming home' and being part of the 'Q-family'. At check-in they ask you for your favourite song, I hoped to hear this in my room, did not, they explained that this is just a different type of check-in..instead of filling-in all possible details they ask you for your favourite color, song, country, hotel etc. Breakfast was excellent, great variety. Go and visit the bar in the evening......

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel with excelent location”
Reviews.Author: rgomesjr
Reviews.Content: The hotel is simply amazing, with great staff, food and best location. I would surely reccomend.

Reviews.Title: “Nice!”
Reviews.Author: bckrSTHLM
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights at the Q, found it to be quiet, modern, small and personal. The room was trendy, clean and all you could ask for if you stay with your partner. The perfect stay for a modern couple. Breakfast was nice and good for a morning hangout. The location just next to Kufürstendam i old "west Berlin" is perfect for shopping and dining, however on the other side of town from elegant and trendy east, more exiting today. no problem at the rates found here, plenty of money over for taxis :-)

Reviews.Title: “Q-uality”
Reviews.Author: RG22UK
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights in one of the normal rooms without a bathtub this January. The room itself was very clean, had all that was needed and comes with ample storage space and free wireless internet. The room and bar / restaurant are very stylish due to being created by well known designers. Food in the restaurant was excellent and we ate there twice in the evenings - the first time ordering starters and main, the second just having starters as they were adequately sized. Drinks can be a bit expensive but they run a promotion on Thursdays (my girlfriend especially liked the glass of champagne for 5 Euro). They allow smoking in the bar area which seems to be due it being private members and hotel guests only. After our flights home were cancelled due to weather problems we phoned the hotel to arrange a further 3 nights. The hotel immediately gave us the booking at the rate we had before and upgraded us for free to the bathtub room (which is really deep and being next to the bed is an interesting quirk). Overall the service was brilliant, the room very stylish and clean and it is ideally situated 2 minutes from the S-Bahn station 'Savignyplatz'. R & L

Reviews.Title: “The Best of Service and style”
Reviews.Author: Berlin-Fanatic
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel "Q" for about 2.5 weeks in December and January. The rooms were a blast. Style, comfort and lots of room! The Private Bar is over the top! Besure to visit when Veit is working. The Staff were very friendly and helpful not at all snobby. I spent New Years Eve there and it was a once in a life time experience. I'm looking for ward to staying there again!

Reviews.Title: “An excellent and trendy hotel”
Reviews.Author: greece4ever
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Q! Hotel Berlin, and we were a bit worried since we read some of the reviews there, stating badly designed rooms and snob service. The truth about the Q! hotel is that it is not for everyone, at least not its bathtub rooms, which are suitable for younger age or design oriented travellers, but this is apparent from everything that is available through the web. Upon arrival we were warmly welcomed, but there was a small problem with our booking, which was fixed immediately, and we were taken to the penthouse suite we reserved in no time. It is a very beautiful room, quite spacious and airy, in an excellent condition. Breakfast has very good options, although it is not the most extensive one we have seen. Service, apart from the small incident on check-in, was one of the best we have encountered, in rarity in trendy properties throughout the world. The location, in the heart of the west part of Berlin, and gives great shopping opportunities.

Reviews.Title: “Design in the middle of the City”
Reviews.Author: Loop79
Reviews.Content: Extraordinary... Not much more to say, this place is highly recommended... Did already book for the next stay...

Reviews.Title: “Red, Hot & Cool (With a Little Dose of Pretentious Thrown In, No Extra Charge!)”
Reviews.Author: mattkorey
Reviews.Content: I had been wanting to stay at the Hotel Q for years. It was on the leading edge of Berlin design hotels, and even a little edgier than most, in that at least it wasn't just an all white hospital theme like they all used to be. This one is all red, but still, it is well done and very classy. As some have noted, you must deal with the front desk staff who dish out snobbery for the most part, but they aren't the worst I've seen. They are just a little full of themselves and sort of think they are the cool kids in town and don't seem to realize that there are lots of design hotels in Berlin now that are just as cool. We'll just let them keep thinking they are the only ones. This is another hotel where you have to make sure you hit it on the right day, as the price fluctuates crazily depending on the nights you stay. The best thing about the Q is their unique design touches. I loved the bathtub adjacent to the bed. Loved it. It's not the most practical, but hotels like this are never about being practical. And downstairs next to the spa is their signature fake beach room with loungers in warm sand, of course the whole thing bathed in red light and some strange red blobs being projected on the walls. Psycho-zen. Another good thing about the Q was the food. I had both room service and the breakfast and both were fantastic. It was one of the only times I have actually decided to go ahead and pay some outrageous amount to have breakfast at the hotel and it was actually almost worth it. The atmosphere is chic even in the day time when they can't shine red lights on everything. It's all just very well done. I would definitely recommend the Q, just don't let them bully you with their attitude at the front desk. Throw it back at them and they'll back down.

Reviews.Title: “DESIGN hotel”
Reviews.Author: CphTwo
Reviews.Content: We found Hotel Q on the internet and spent four nights there. Our reason for going to Berlin was to have a short romantic break, and since we love design hotels we looked for one in Berlin. - And Hotel Q surely lived up to our expectations! We arrived quite late (around 23.00) and the first thing that meets you is the red coulours. It may sound cheap, but trust us saying it doesn't look that way when you are there. The hotel is quite small and narrow, and similarly the rooms aren't that big. However, they don't feel that small as they are filled with nice details. E.g. the bathroom is integrated in the living area, so you actually sleep right next to the tub. May sound crazy and weird but it works. Please note that it is not all rooms which has a tub - remember to ask for one. On the ground floor you find the lounge/nightclub, which also serves as restaurant for both breakfast, lunch and dinner. It is almost over-designed, but really cool. On top of this the staff at the hotel is extremely professional and serviceminded. We started out living in a room without a tub, and wanted to move. First of all it was no problem - and it didn't cost extra - but they actually offered us to move our bags, so the new room would be ready when we returned from a day with sightseeing. Finally we will mention the breakfast which is absolutely fantastic! They offer more or less the same as at other hotels, but it is all much much nicer. Small details as the eggs prepared your way with basil and tomatoes or whatever you like, the use of only top produces, great selection of full grain bread, small portions of youhurt which tastes as it doesn't come from Danone etc. etc. In other words a fantastic hotel - only downside is found in the rooms: the toilet is seperate from the rest of "the bathroom" so there is no sink here.

Reviews.Title: “The bath!! lovely.”
Reviews.Author: casaBmajorca
Reviews.Content: We had a couple of nights at the Hotel Q and loved it. Good sized double bedroom with great bath next to the bed , infront of the flat screen telly... what more can you ask for?! Aveda products, clean, ipod station. lovely staff on the front desk. clean cool spa, with sand room for relaxing, good location for the ´´posh´´ end shops.and walking distance to the famous department store which has the most amazing foodhall. Good restaurants all round, mainly right out of the door, ask the reception to recommend you. jump on the number 200 bus for a round trip tour of Berlin rather than the tourist bus. Up in the East, there is a feel of ´new york, greenwich villagey, with great small boutiques and vintage shops. . the only slight slight thing would be more comprehensive room info, better map, and maybe a cheaper breakfast...at 20 euros per person, we nipped out for our coffee and cake, as we couldnt possibly justify 40 euros a couple... unless you eat and eat and eat. but we are planning a return next year

Reviews.Title: “Nice Design Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MCMember
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights as part of a combined business trip, booking one of the Junior Suite rooms. We arrived too early for the room to be ready and staff were helpful in storing our luggage and giving us an indication as to when at the earliest the room could be ready. The room had a pleasant layout (sofa, flat screen TV, large bed, open space bathroom) with excellent design although this is now common in that type of hotel. Plenty of extras such as the Wii console. Room service is palatable and efficient. Staff were helpful throughout the stay in giving indications and getting taxis. The special offer we took was great value for money without cutting on the service. Very good location as well not far from the former French zone which is home to many nice place and designer shops (not sure the best bargains will be found there, though).

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Cool”
Reviews.Author: Rubyleigh
Reviews.Content: Nestled away on a quite street of Ku,Dam, the exterior is an unassuming grey building. Once you step inside it has the cool factor from minimalist decor to the red carpet and white walls throughout. It is quite small, reception just as you come through main door, bar on the same floor and lounge area where buffet breakfast is served for 20 euro per person. Dinner each evening which is mainly Thai. Only residents and members can use the bar and facilities. The bedrooms again are minimalist with the bath beside the bed. Mini bar full of all sorts..mmm...double lollipops?? There is a spa area downstairs which did'nt get to use. Not sure if that's because it's a naked area or because we were busy sightseeing but my excuse is the sightseeing.. The location of this hotel is great. In a really nice area of Berlin, close to designer and boutique stores. lots of lovely restaurants nearby including Jules vernes which serves lovely breakfast. Overall this hotel is very cool but the test factor is would I stay here again and absolutely I would but next time I'll make it to the spa!

Reviews.Title: “Love it!”
Reviews.Author: Thousandeurist
Reviews.Content: My favourite design hotel ever!!! I love it. Located in Kurfurstendamm (nice neighbourhood in the former western Berlin, main shopping street) it is now a bit far for the main city attractions, although there is a tram nearby and plenty of taxis around. 300 m to Savignyplatz packed with bars and restaurants. The room layout is futuristic, mainly in black and white, with the bathroom close to the bed, a/c, bathrobes and quality toiletries. It features a spa, solarium and sauna. The lounge bar is decorated in red and chrome, and a clever lighting that make your drink a very pleasant experience. Beautiful, modern, it’s worth a visit. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Fun place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Navibarnsley
Reviews.Content: "Designer" boutique hotels can be hit and miss, but this was definitely more hit . The slide down from the bath into the bed, the irreverant staff and the great Q special cocktail they were serving when we stayed all helped push this one into the "hit" category. The hotel is well located for getting to most of Berlin's best clubs and also for walking through the park across the city during the day. Almost everything in the room is white, and the corridors and reception are bathed in red light. The view from our window was not great but Berlin is hardly the city in which you spend time looking out of your window (or even that long in the roon). The bed was fine - one thing to be careful of is that it is easy to lose things down the side of the mattress, in which case you need to pull up the whole mattress to retrieve them. A minor point. The bathroom is fun, there a perfectly adequate shower and then a bath next to the bed with a slide down into the bed (well, it's probably not meant to be a slide). A lot of fun. This type of hotel really needs to keep the maintenance up if it is to carry off it's moody red theme. This does that well on the whole.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and trying too hard therefore failing miserably”
Reviews.Author: Rhino_Traveller
Reviews.Content: This hotel, whilst being in an excellent location just off one of the main shopping streets and close to some nice restaurants, fails miserably. The lighting is red......every light in the place is red, including corridors, communal areas, spa and the toilets, giving it the impression of a brothel! The rooms are sparse with little of the creature comforts that you might expect from a hotel in a similar price bracket. The beds are small, very soft, and you are only supplied with a single pillow, not making for the best nights sleep. Overall the hotel rates itself far too highly and in trying to be a minimalist, chic and cool hotel it actually results in a overpriced, unrelaxing and uncomfortable stay. I have stayed in many boutique hotels around the world and this is by far the most disappointing and worst I have stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Not really worth it”
Reviews.Author: Minifee-Europe
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Q for work - I would not have paid the price if I had been travelling personnally. It is very close to the K' dam (major luxury area in Brussels) For a work session, I found the hotel not very appropriate. It is very design and all arranged in red colors - definitely sex oriented - perfect if you plan a hot, hot week end. Desks are too small to really work. It very much depends on what you are looking for. I enjoyed much more the Mercure - I think if was called Stadmitte. I'll do a separate review on it as soon as I have time

Reviews.Title: “Great design hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: Hammerstein
Reviews.Content: A very stylish design hotel with a lot to offer and not too far from city centre! + We absolutely loved the funky rooms! The fantastic breakfast. The cosy lounge in the evening. + We liked the location and the fair price. - We would have liked a not so arrogant service at the front desk the first time we visited the hotel. (We arrived at the hotel after having travelled from Austria by car in really warm weather, so we didn't really look as trendy as some of the other guests in the reception)

Reviews.Title: “Good style!”
Reviews.Author: Th0masN0rway
Reviews.Content: Location is good in Berlin as I now and at check-in a small problem since I did order over internet. The staff is very polite and effective. I did choose this hotel because of the design and it was not so bad. I did get the feeling of a brothel when I go out of the elevator and to the rooms, and this is only because they have red lights in the hallway. Dont they have like this on brothels?;) Anyway, the place have good style, plays some Budda Bar music in hallways, have a very good bar and all over very cool design that you not often see at hotels. Rooms are good all over, but if I shall find some negative things it is this; germans never understand that tourist not like German TV. The TV had something like 40 channels and all speak German. Have you seen Pamela Anderson speak german? You dont want it either! But hey, then you have a reason to go out in the evening!

Reviews.Title: “Great visit”
Reviews.Author: jellyfish11
Reviews.Content: When I stayed here in April I had a very good visit. The hotel is similar to the photos on the hotel website, but without the plants and bath products. The room is completely open plan and provides no privacy so make sure you stay with your loved one, or a very close friend because they will see you in the nude! I stayed here for 4 nights. On the first night however, I did not have a bath in my room so requested a room change at reception. We were moved the following morning. No protography was allowed in the bar, but we discovered that the hotel is used as a get-away for some well known celebs! There are some wonderful places to eat just along the street in a trendy square. I would definately stay here again, but it would probably spoil my memories of such a good trip.

Reviews.Title: “I would have expected something better...”
Reviews.Author: GeorgeDunlop
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Q! and expected a wonderful design hotel with helpful staff and good drinks at the Hotel Bar. The funny thing is that I have experienced non of the above. The barkeepers were quite helpless mixing a proper drink and after a number of different cocktails, I decided to give up on the idea of drinking any "ok" cocktails at the bar. The rooms are a bit unpractical and I believe that they should be redone to accommodate people from all walks of life. The room with the bathtub next to the bed requires a ladder to get in and out of the bathtub. Although I experience a few nice people working there, one can say that the staff I had to deal with was anything but professional. Members of staff seem to think you are their buddy of some sorts because they pretty much lack the respect a customer is used to in Hotels like the Kempinski, Sheraton or Hilton. The only good part about my stay in the hotel was the really friendly night porter and the friendly lady who served in the bar/lobby. Unfortunately, she doesn't have a steady job there and only works from time to time. If they really want to provide 5 star service, they need to work on it. I will not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of the construction”
Reviews.Author: ClarkRB
Reviews.Content: Hotel Q! seemed to be one of the different places we would be staying at during our European tour. It was correct at not having a sign out front. Parking was difficult as almost all spots in the adjacent garage were taken. The hotel was a bit tacky for my taste, and seemed to resemble more of a hotel geared for erotica. Shag carpeting and a cheesy wand to open your door. Neat room; unlike some reviewers we did have the hot tub next to the bed. Hotel had loud bar downstairs, mainly frequented by older men and younger women. The younger women are eyeing the mens money. The men are ogling the women. The construction of the adjacent building the next day started exactly at 0800L. No way one could sleep though that. No warning was given for this, even though this appears to be an ongoing project. Overall the hotel was OK. Inquire about construction next door prior to getting the reservation.

Reviews.Title: “what a scam!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: whattohell
Reviews.Content: Beware of this hotel!!! They present everywhere pictures of their suite but ordinary doubles are far away from that and they not inform about that. Very uncomfortable rooms with separate restrooms but not even a sink inside to wash a hands inside,light switches altogheter so you don` know what light you put on in the middle of the night. I was very dissappointed for this kind misleading me as a customer and do not recommend this hotel at all. For such a price I would get room in many hotels around this location. Be aware!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! DJ from New York

Reviews.Title: “Modern boutique”
Reviews.Author: bel80
Reviews.Content: Hotel Q is very modern and sleek. I guess it's more of a younger traveller's ideal accommodation - with the bar downstairs, and the young staff who are able to give you tips about the best bars, foodies, etc in town. We loved our room which was different from what we'd been used to (normal modern hotel style) - it's very sleek, and there's even heated tiles! The shower is even big enough for two! With no wall to separate the bathroom to the bedroom, it gives the impression of lots of space, something hotels could think about? And the toilettries are fabulous (Aveda products)! Unfortunately, it is a bit out of where the central sites are in Berlin, but Charlottenburg is quiet, with very easy access to the main Zoo station, and just a 5 minute walk to the high street shops.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely dissapointing”
Reviews.Author: dahendrixmaster
Reviews.Content: After having seen the pictures when I booked this hotel 6 months in advance I was very excited to see the modern rooms and get a bit of a change from the typical old crummy hotels which are all too common these days. 1. When i arrived I was told the room wouldnt be ready till 3. A bit annoying as i wasn't notified as I booked through expedia and never got an email confirmation from the hotel itself. But not a big problem. 2. The rooms MASSIVELY dissapointed me. I had a single room and it was a plain bog standard white room. It had a pretentious tiny green plant on the table and the only modern thing in the room was a flat screen TV. I must say the bathroom was nice and modern but no more than I would expect from a newly constructed hotel. There was no cool tub next to bed cool integration like in the pictures of what are apparently the double rooms. Really when I walked in I thought what! I thought it was supposed to be modern and trendy. The hotel itself is quite modern though, the reception and even elevators are quite modern feeling, but it all stops at the door of the room. The view from the room was straight into some other guys kitchen. Rubbish. 3. The absolute killer was the Hotel Q bar/club downstairs playing ridiculously loud house music until 4 am. How a hotel can play music so loud it disturbs its own guests from sleeping is beyond me. I called reception a few times but I understand that they weren't about to kick out the 60 people that were partying. For the $$$ I paid there are much better hotels. The only plus is location. right on the ku/dam. Yours truly- an angry 23 year old.

Reviews.Title: “more reservation problems”
Reviews.Author: blacksheep1
Reviews.Content: We flew to Berlin for one night as a romantic anniversary break. The hotel was booked a month in advance and the confirmation email states an allocated check in time of 3pm. On arrival at 3:30pm we were told that there had been a mistake in the booking and we would have to stay at a similar hotel in close proximity for the same price €180. This was upsetting and obviously had a negative impact on our stay. The 'similar' hotel was a chain hotel in the main tourist area 10 minutes away. There was no comparison in style or location. There was no discount given for being moved and although the room was suggested as an upgrade to the room we had been allocated in hotel q I wonder why we had been allocated such a poor room in the first place ? We were offered use of the facilities at hotel Q but we did not want to use the facilities we wanted to stay in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Love Hotel Q!”
Reviews.Author: JETraveler
Reviews.Content: Upon our arrival at the Hotel Q! we were given a tour of the facilities including our room and the spa facilities downstairs by a member of the friendly staff. The room was a great design with a bathtub in the room much like the one in pictures on the website. The aveda products were a great perk. We booked the room for about $130 on Expedia, and it was worth the price. The bar downstairs is quite swanky and only allows guests of the hotel to enter, so it is pretty low key, although the drinks are a little pricier than some of the other places we went-about 7-8 euro. The location was great within walking distance to Savignyplatz and Zoo stops, very central. The spa facilities were quite nice although we did not have an opportunity to use them due to our short stay. They offered a sauna, tanning, and massage. The key to finding the hotel is realizing that Knesebeckstrasse appears to dead end on either side of the Savignyplatz, but in fact continues on the other side. If you do not find the address of the hotel on the Knesebeckstrasse you encounter, simply walk across or drive around the Savignyplatz, a square which is approximately 1/5 mile long. I would definitely recommend this hotel and stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Very cool Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tomtom333
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night to go sightseeing and had been recommended the Hotel. Very trendy. Excellent service and staff. Rooms are minimalist and would be no good if you wanted to spend any time in them to watch TV or relax. But they were spacious and well equipped and clean. The bar was great for cocktails. We did not eat there. The Hotel location is great for restaurants in the surrounding streets. Aircon was great. Breakfast was good with an excellent buffet. I would recommend this hotel for a fun, short stay. It beats the large hotels by a mile.

Reviews.Title: “Awful problems with reservation”
Reviews.Author: Tomme
Reviews.Content: Had a guaranteed reservation via hotels[--] for my family. The Q! would not accept the price and only contacted me again on massive complaints. Unfair, unwilling and annoying staff! So I was glad I had cancelled the hotel before even entering it (what might have happende then????) So if you go there, better triple-check before (see other reviews as well).

Reviews.Title: “Great location and a different experience”
Reviews.Author: solskjaer
Reviews.Content: A great hotel. After being on the road in Germany for several weeks and usually staying in boring business hotels I decided to try Q when I had a couple of days off in Berlin. Great service in the reception and in the bar, a nice clean room that is very different from the normal business-rooms I usually stay inn and a fantastic spa-area in the basement. The location is perfect in a nice part of Berlin with a lot of restaurants, cafes and shopping. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. Great desing, friendly staff and not very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the sand room!”
Reviews.Author: Liz1
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights as a birthday treat. The hotel is as unique as mentioned in all the previous reviews. Just to add to the previous reviews.. We had plenty of toilet roll! No problems. We were shown to our room by the hotel staff and shown the location of hairdyers etc. The green light won't bother you if you are a good sleeper like me but my husband did notice it. We stayed on the 5th floor overlooking the street and there was no noise. We drank in the bar with no problems. We really enjoyed using the hotel steam room and sauna. Gown etc are provided and the opportunity to lie on a lounger on an indoor beach (sand room) was very relaxing. Definately for couples, groups or anybody is fed up with standard hotels. Very different!

Reviews.Title: “Cool design and good location, but no attention to detail”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I'm a leisure traveler and love to stay in hotels. I probably spend more time inside them than most guests (it helps curb my constant desire to redecorate my place). As such, please keep in mind that if you're a business traveler who only sleeps at your hotel and perhaps has meals there, you probably wouldn't mind the Q, but then you shouldn't be staying there, since it's a boutique hotel that doesn't go out of its way to cater to business people. Anyway, I stayed at the Q hotel for 3 nights, and I was impressed by the overall look of the place, but not by its atmosphere. I expect hotels to feel like home away from home, and this one didn't. Its unique interiors are very stylish, but I found them to be in the way of comfort. The standard room layout works well for a single guest - if you're staying there with someone else, you two better be close...;) I found the green light annoying as well (this was mentioned in the other reviews), and I agree that it was difficult to work the heating/air conditioning system. The hotel staff were generally polite and helpful, and recommended some good restaurants and nightclubs. However, the bar/restaurant staff were not as attentive as they should be. Speaking of which, I did fork out the 18 Euros for breakfast buffet each morning, and I liked it very much, even though it was overpriced. The food selection was varied and interesting. For example, they served a hearty version of miso soup - a typical Japanese breakfast item, which was neat. I also liked the individual servings of fruit in little jars, which was probably the only thing about this hotel that warmed my heart (other than the soup). Everything else felt too cool, too plain, too impersonal. I heard that Angelina Jolie and Brad Pitt stayed there for a night during their visit to Berlin (they left the kids somewhere else) - good choice, because this hotel is only fun when you're there with someone else whose company you enjoy. Plus, it's quite private, as there is no big sign outside and the location is very central yet off the main drag, K'Damm. Overall, the Q is one of those places that are just too cool for their own good. If you care much about style and don't like traditional/boring interiors, I recommend it. If you like to feel special and thoughfully cared for, pick some place else.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel for couples”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not quite as funky as it looks in the photos but it is different in a nice way. We are not a young couple (wrong side of 50) but we liked the contemporary design and youthful atmosphere. We didn't feel out of place. The room we had was spotless, the enormous bed was very comfortable and the staff were very friendly. Unlike the other reviewers we did not find the bar out of bounds, We also thought it quite reasonable priced as the alcohol measures were generous, In fact we thought eating and drinking in Berlin was quite reasonable (compared to London and Paris). I would recommend it to couples for a romantic weekend away although Berlin itself is a bit bleak in March, probably much better in spring or summer.

Reviews.Title: “Loved staying here...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After having done several searches on the internet for 'interesting' hotels to stay in, in Berlin, I came across this one. I booked one of the 'studio' rooms - which is just like the room pictured on the website. It had the bath attached to the bed, big walk in shower, double sinks, seating area, moveable plasma screen...etc. Checking in was a quick and painless, very friendly staff who speak excellent english. Our room was on the top floor (7th) and looked out to the front of the building, I wasn't dissapointed. There were 2 floor length windows which were a nice touch too. We did a quick unpack, at which point I wondered where the drawers were, I had to stand on the very big brotheresque chair to put some clothes on the shelves above the hanging space. I opened another cuboard and found there to be a safe - which you set your own combination, and the mini bar, which was scant - I had read the reviews so I was prepared for the horror of only 3 minitures, 2 beers, 4 waters and several juices and mixers, there were also some curious items above the minibar, which I can't remember what they were but one I presume was some sort of caffeine product as it was called 'snoozes for loosers' or something?! The tv had me slightly flumoxed, the room guide advised that there was a BBC but alas I couldn't find it so we were stuck with CNN international and MTV. Even though we arrived quite late we decided to go to the bar - as expected this is slightly expensive, so we had 2 drinks and retired for the evening. The bed was very comfortable, and for those like myself who find themselves in a nightly battle for duvet space - you get one each!! YAY! I also slept really well in that bed. I made use of the aveda products but I have to say, I'm not sure whether it was the products or the Berlin water but my hair felt strange here, I washed it each day, and spent longer rinsing it each time, but it still felt like there was a residue or something left in it. We decided that we would not stay in the hotel for breakfast €18 each is just ridiculous, and there was nothing speacial on the menu anyway. The hotel is abot 40 meters from the Ku'damm so we went round to the coffee shop round the corner 'Carras' and got coffees and croissants instead. They also do these tubs of yogurt with raspberries and oats in it which sounds a bit odd but it was really good and really substantial, will keep you going for hours. The restaurant next door to Carras - Petrocelli (Italian)is a must, the atmosphere on a Tuesday night was quite unbelievable, and the waiters, well they really made the place, our waiter in particular made it his mission to make us feel welcome and try new food. I half expected the waiters to leap onto the tables and start some sort of caberet, they were all so camp! Decided that we would give the hotel restaurant a miss -going by the breakfast and drinks prices and besides we wanted to get out of the hotel and try other places. As our flight home wasn't until 8.30 in the evening we checked if we could leave our luggage at the hotel for the day - which was no problem. The closest S-Bahn station to the hotel is Savigny Platz (probably spelt wrong) and about 45 mins from Shoenfeld - direct train, hurrah. We found the public transport really easy to work out and get around. I would go back to this hotel, it is perfectly placed for getting around Berlin. Berlin is truely amazing and really pretty in the snow.

Reviews.Title: “Not as nice as it looks...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Sorry if this is a bit long, but you may find it helpful. I recently stayed at Hotel Q with my wife. We were there for three nights over new years. We are both in our twenties and I was looking forward to going to Berlin as I lived there as a child and wanted it to be a bit special by staying somewhere that wasn’t just your average hotel. And Hotel Q seemed to fit the bill. The website really does make it look stunning, if you like that sort of thing. I had read reviews by people who’d stayed there and tried to take a balanced view, as they are personal opinions. So, once we got to the hotel from S Bahnhof Savigny Platz and walked into reception, everything looked fine. I knew that the hotel was small, so the reception area being quite small too, didn’t disappoint me. Check in was a piece of cake, with friendly staff that spoke good English. I liked the red carpet in the lift and the red-lit corridor. Unusual, so I liked it. Our room was on the first floor, directly above the reception and overlooking the street. Finding the correct room was a little tricky as the room number wasn’t on the door. (I knew the hotel was trying to be different, but I wasn’t expecting that…) Anyhow, the number is on the side of the light by the door, so look out for that. As we entered the room everything looked clean and tidy. I did notice straight away that there was no bath next to the bed thing though. Never mind, there was a nice shower…. I think it would be good if their website showed some of the standard rooms instead of all those sinks. The room was clean and after a few minutes checking it out I was happy enough. The design was different and I didn’t mind the wooden floors. All this was expected. And I began wonder about some of the negative reviews by other guests. People saying they couldn’t find the hairdryer or lock the door or work the heating system. None of that was exactly difficult to figure out and there was always the option to ring the front desk. However, there were a few negatives during our stay. For instance, the toilet paper. I don’t know about you, but I like toilet paper to be well stocked. There was one spare roll and one that was half used, but was folded in the way they do, to make it look nice. I thought that would be ok, as the maid would top them up the next morning. That didn’t happen, so I had to ring reception to ask for some more, which was quite embarrassing. They did send someone up immediately. The thing is, they only brought one roll! In the end, we ended up hiding the roll we had, so that the maid would see that we had none left and would be forced to stock up. Anyhow, enough of the toilet rolls fiasco! The other thing, which I’m sure they didn’t think would be annoying when they installed them, was the air con switch. I noticed someone else writing about this. There is a little green LED light on it that flashed. Fine during they day, but during the night it casts some huge green halo across the opposite wall that looks like they are trying to call batman. In the end, I had to cover it up with a plaster. We went to the bar one evening to try out the cocktails. (Don’t have the Q Cocktail. It’s horrible.) Service was great, no problem there. It was a bit pricey mind and smoky. (I know, it’s a bar, but be prepared for that in Berlin. We couldn’t find a single place to eat where people weren’t smoking.) Nice looking place too, although, it did look a bit ‘MDF’ overload. (They had a private party new years eve, so hotel guests not allowed in!) All pretty small things you may think, and you may be right. However, the most annoying thing was the noise. As we were on the first floor and directly above the reception and the bar, we could hear the music from downstairs. Not loud enough to keep you awake though. But it was very bad on New Years Eve. I was prepared for that as the whole city was partying. However, whoever was singing needed some lessons and that time it was loud enough to keep you awake and it felt like he was in the room with us. I had to ring reception to ask how long he would be going on till and they said until 3AM. So not much sleep there then. Perhaps they should have put in better soundproofing. So I suggest you book a room that’s at least on the second floor, if not higher. So all in all, I have no complaints about the staff, but more about the hotel in general. If you don’t mind some noise when you’re trying to sleep and trendy decor then go for it, if not, then I wouldn’t recommend it. Ps. Hope you enjoy the pictures.

Reviews.Title: “Basically a three star hotel with good fittings”
Reviews.Author: Lb100
Reviews.Content: Based in a great location two minutes walk from U and S bahn stations with plenty to do locally, this hotel has a lot of promise. Certainly it is well fitted and quirky. Our room had a bed and washing bowl in one fitting and an excellent shower opening out on to the room. The design is stark with a red and white theme in the public areas, white and dark wood in the rooms. The pictures on the hotel’s website are not of the standard rooms so don’t expect a bath next to the bed unless you are paying top dollar. The bed was large and comfortable with two separate duvets. There were small containers of Avenda products and a poorly stocked mini bar. Other room features included a complicated air conditioning/heating system the controls of which glowed green and needed covering up during the night. The public areas consist of a small lobby, not much more than a corridor, and a private members bar which is also open to residents. However, as other reviews have noted, access to hotel guests is sporadic and on arrival we were informed that we were not welcome on New Year’s eve. However, when allowed in, the Bar is fantastic if expensive and well worth passing a few hours over a Cosmopolitan or Daiquiri. The bar also doubles up as the restaurant although our room rate did not include breakfast which at 18 Euros is rather steep. The lack of a hotel breakfast is no great loss as the nearby Savignyplatz is home to some excellent Cafés – the Café Savigny does a wonderful fresh breakfast for around 10 Euros. However where this hotel really lets itself down is in pretending to be more than a interestingly designed three star hotel. The concierge service was the reception staff and they were usually busy with booking in guests to be really helpful; there is no business centre - although Wi-Fi access is available; and there was very little information in the room about the hotels services other than those sold through the hotel’s spa. Little things demonstrate this weakness. When we asked to borrow an iron the request came as surprise to the reception staff who explained that they did not normally lend them, but graciously they would make an exception for ten minutes. Not what you would expect from a hotel that is billed as four and half stars. To be fair to the hotel we only paid a three star price, 100 euros a night for the New Year period. Good value – for the comfortable room and location alone. But don’t come here for an exceptional experience – that is reserved for the website design.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended!”
Reviews.Author: Jan69_10
Reviews.Content: I was having doubts about this hotel after reading of the experiences of the travellers who had booked their break through Expedia like we had, and was expecting the worst! However we had no problems at all - reception staff were pleasant & welcoming, even asking us to ring down if we had any trouble finding anything in the room. However the hotel is a little hard to find & as it's new taxi drivers don't always know where it is, so I would recommend that you have the street number to hand! The room itself was beautiful, spotlessly clean & minimalist in design. We didn't have a bath, but a huge slate tiled shower which was great to use. The corridors have lovely lighting which automatically comes on when you open the door. The area the hotel is in is fantastic - we stayed there 4 nights & there are so many great places to eat in the locale that we didn't feel the need to venture out of the area in the evening. This was my first visit to Berlin & I loved everything about it & would recommend it & the Q! to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed it, Great Location, Good Service but a bit Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: privacylawyer
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Q! at the end of November. While the hotel is a bit pricey for what you get, overall the location and service prevail. The rooms are a bit funky (watch out for the sloping edge of the bed . . . slight tripping hazard!). We arrived at 10am, well before check-in and only expected to drop our luggage off before heading out. Michael and the other staff members were extremely apologetic, and offered to ring us on our mobile when the room became ready . . . which was a mere 30 minutes later! Another staff member showed us to our room, fully explaining the unique key entry, location of the hair dryer, and the other quirky aspects of the room. Michael suggested a fantastic restaurant (thank you again!), and also suggested Sachs, great restaurant, great atmosphere on the same street as the hotel, 40 meters opposite from Ku'Damm. The hotel member-guest bar is not particularly notable (would have been nice to have had the fireplace working), but is decent place for a nightcap (although again on the pricey side). The location is exceptional, very close to beautiful shops, good restaurants, and relatively close to Tegel airport (approx. 20 euros). The hotel is difficult to locate, however, and we were lucky our taxi driver knew it -- look for the dark grey building between 2 white buildings, with the address on the front in silver numbers. Berlin is an amazing city, and was beautifully decorated for the holidays. We would stay at the Q! again, despite being on the pricey side.

Reviews.Title: “Better stay elsewhere!”
Reviews.Author: HotelfanNetherlands
Reviews.Content: I really don't understand how people like this hotel. I have travelled a lot and I have stayed in several boutique hotels all around the world, but the Q does not deserve at all this title.I stayed with my husband for three nights at the end of November 2005 in this hotel and our stay was from the first till the last moment a disappointment. We closed the hotel through expedia (so no breakfast included) and that was already a reason enough to be treated badly at the check-in. Not smiling, not welcoming but only explaining coldly that we will have to pay 18 euros per person if we want to have breakfast there. We took our luggage to our room and there we understood that the rooms have *nothing* to do with the picture on the website. If one has the slightest idea about architecture understands that the rooms were not according to the minimilastic style the hotel is proud of, but they are simply cheaply made.
