Of course there was no bathtub, just a dirty shower full of chalk. The Aveda products were there but don't fool yourself. There is just a little soap, shampoo and body cream-no conditioner. The hair-dryer was so well hidden, that I had to call the reception to unvail me the secret place where it was. Mini bar was awful-and half full. Probably they forgot to fill it after the last customer left. The first day the air-conditioning did not work so we had to sleep in the cold (outside the temperature was -5 Celcius). The rest of the room was tastelessly done, just white and plain metallic windows; nothing special. Due to the fact that there was an additional trick in order to close the door from inside when we were sleeping, which we were never informed about, next morning we had to face the invasion of the cleaning person at 8:45am! Unacceptable! The corridors were lit with a red light which I never understood. Only positive of the hotel, it's fantastic location. Just off Ku'damm and near Bleibtreustrasse and Savignyplatz with all its nice restaurants, cafés and little shops. For 18 euros per person we of course did not even dare to try the breakfast and the restaurant/bar was always empty when we were coming in or leaving the hotel, so we didn't feel like trying either. And a last thing, we got a price through expedia of 105euros for the room per night but then expedia charged us with extra 30 euros for service! In the end the offer they had was not really an offer (let alone the fact that I had to pre-pay everything at the beginning of August to get this special rate). I don't think I'll ever use expedia again and I definitely will not stay at the Q next time I am in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: NYCfanUk
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a romantic break in Berlin, where we stayed at Q for 3 nights and I must say we absolutely loved it there! Although a little hard to find at first, once inside, the reception, bedrooms and bar area are all super stylish - especially loved the plush red carpet in the lift and throughout the corridors. The room itself was spacious with a minimalistic style - complimentary aveda products were a big hit. One moan on the room though - ours did not have a bath which we were lead to believe was standard. It did, however have a walk-in slate tiled shower big enough for 2! The thing that really impressed us was how approachable and friendly the staff were - they were absolutely delightful and went out of their way to make our stay a real experience, plus girls go away with a little gift upon check out! Couldn't recommend this Hotel enough. If minimalistic chic is your thing - then there's only place to stay in Berlin - Hotel Q!

Reviews.Title: “Warning - Night Club that pretends to be a hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: foodmad
Reviews.Content: This hotel is basically a tiny nightclub with very stylish bedrooms. The spa outside the treatments rooms consists of a very small sauna and steam room and another room with 4 orange lilos sitting in sand. We did not enjoy staying in this hotel at all and were so disappointed as we were really looking forward to staying there. We arrived down to the bar from our room for a drink and dinner on the first night of our stay(Saturday)only to be told that there was a private party in the hotel that night. Fair enough - it happens, but we wouldn't have stayed there if we had known this in advance. But we were very embarrassed to be treated like gatecrashers at the hotels bar/restaurant in front of 'invited' party guests. In addition to this, no room service was available to us either as all staff were allocated to the private party. No food, no drinks....in a hotel?? totally unacceptable. This issue was never addressed all weekend by hotel management eventhough we called and even left notes at reception. Obviously we were not happy paying full whack for 'room only' facilities but no manager was available all weekend to sort this out. On the plus side - we found a truly great restaurant around the corner which we would never have found called 'The Room' on Schlüterstraße 52. Superb food. So if you still want to stay in Q! I would double check and double check again that the hotel is actually operating as a hotel during your stay as opposed to a nightclub.
